chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristofer M Landolt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Perform Alcohol Assessment.

No operation of a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Follow through with any counseling or treatment recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kristofer M Landolt in court, in custody.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court will not proceed with the discharge hearing today as Attorney Kershek does not appear.  The Court will address the discharge hearing on Monday, November 28, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.    The Defendant is allowed free telephone calls to contact his attorney.  The Defendant is to remain in custody at the Waukesha County Jail until his discharge hearing.

The Court recalls the case.  Defendant Kristofer M Landolt in court, in custody.  Attorney Kershek appears in person. Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court the defendant does not want to contest discharge from the program.  The Court discharges the Defendant from the program.   State and staffing team motion for discharge.  Statement made by the defendant.  Defendant is formally discharged from ATC.

November 22, 2016: DEFENDANT DISCHARGED FROM ATC. DEFENDANT IS TO SERVE BALANCE OF ORIGINAL SENTENCE. PLUS IS ENTITLED TO ADDITIONAL CREDIT since released from Huber to ATC on  4/26/16 of: 3 days Sanctions and 135 days SCRAM/SCRAM-X plus in custody credit from 10/15/16 through today 11/22/16 which is a total of 39 days for a total credit of 177 Days Credit.

The November 28, 2016 at 1:30 has been canceled as the Defendant was discharged from ATC.
Defendant Kristofer M Landolt in court, in custody.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The discharge hearing will be heard during alcohol treatment court on 11/22/16.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Sanction/Discharge.

Defendant Kristofer M Landolt in court, in custody.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and staffing team motion for discharge.  State provides copy of Notice of Motion for Discharge to the defendant. Defendant allowed 1 free phone call to his employer at the convenience of the jail during his employers normal business hours.  Defendant to remain in custody.

Defendant Kristofer M Landolt in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on noncompliance: the Court orders a 60 hour sanction to be served as straight time. Defendant to be released the morning of Sunday, September 25, 2016 in accordance to jail procedures. Defendant remanded to custody of the Sheriff.
Defendant Kristofer M Landolt in court.    Defendant remains compliant with the program.
